title: Demi Lovato is 'devastated' after friend dies from substance abuse
text:
The star struggled from substance abuse herself (Picture: Instagram/Getty)

Demi Lovato is ‘devastated’ after her friend died from his struggle with drug addiction.

The 27-year-old revealed on her Instagram stories that she lost her friend Thomas on Tuesday night, following his battle with substance abuse.

‘Devastated. Please hold your loved ones tight. Tell them they are special and that you love them,’ the Sober singer wrote in her story.

‘Make sure they know it. RIP to my boo @sirtruss.’

Demi has battled addiction herself, so it can’t have been easy for her to relive certain scenarios.

She urged her fans in her second story to help anyone they know who is struggling with addiction.

The post read: ‘Addiction is NO joke.. heaven gained this beautiful angel last night because of that terrible disease.

‘I’m crushed and will always miss you @sirtruss. If you or someone you know is struggling please know it’s okay to ask for help.’

Thomas passed away on Tuesday (Picture: Instagram/@ddlovato)

The singer has been sober for over a year (Picture: Instagram/@ddlovato)

The star suffered a drug overdose herself on July 2018 and was rushed to a Los Angeles hospital.

Demi has fought substance abuse for years and has spoken about seeking treatment in the past, celebrating six years of sobriety in March 2018 after battling cocaine and Oxycontin addiction.

She also struggled with mental illness and eating disorders for years and first broke her silence on her addiction and struggles in August 2018, sharing an update on her health and discussing her ongoing battle in a statement on social media.

‘I have always been transparent about my journey with addiction. What I’ve learned is that this illness is not something that disappears or fades with time. It is something I must continue to overcome and have not done yet,’ Demi wrote.

‘I want to thank God for keeping me alive and well,’ she added, before praising her fans for supporting her through thick and thin. ‘I now need time to heal and focus on my sobriety and road to recovery. The love you have all shown me will never be forgotten and I look forward to the day where I can say I came out on the other side. I will keep fighting.’

She is over a year sober now and we couldn’t be more proud of her.
